text.__SUMMARY__: Acacia ophiolithica is a shrub of the genus Acacia and the subgenus Plurinerves. It is native to an area along the south coast of the Goldfields-Esperance region of Western Australia.The dense rounded shrub typically grows to a height of 0.3 to 2 metres (1 to 7 ft). It blooms from August to October and produces yellow flowers.
